intro: Veronica brachtii, commonly known as the mountain veronica, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in dense spikes. Veronica brachtii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
